content.body: Hiya. Possibly a silly question, but I'm implementing bindings for a WebAssembly powered mruby framework, and I was wondering where I can download .idl files for WHATWG specs. I've had a hunt around but struggled to find any downloads. Is the intention to parse the spec itself to create the .idl files?
Ohh I had just been looking through the WebIDL docs, hadn't realized that the IDL is just at the bottom of the file in each spec. Should be fairly easy to grab.
https://github.com/w3c/webref/tree/main/ed/idl has continuously-updated IDL files for every spec, not just WHATWG ones
annevk: so about the status-code-in-CORS-messages thing, I actually ended up writing a patch — so I’ll raise the bug and then also attach that patch
content.formatted_body: annevk: so about the status-code-in-CORS-messages thing, I actually ended up writing a patch — so I’ll raise the bug and then also attach that patch

content.body: sideshowbarker: okay, I worry a bit about conflicts as my PR is still outstanding and also touches that, but we'll see I guess
